ul.li: Checks continuity of both systems.
Illuminates the ENG FIRE warning light and the OVERHEAT caution light.
OXY QTY - Drives the pointer on the Oxygen Supply Indicator to zero; as the pointer passes 0.5 liters, the OXY LOW caution light comes on.
OFF - Normal operation.

area.title: Malfunction and Indicator Lights Test Button

ul.li: Operates relays which test the illumination of all warning, caution, and indicator lights, the LG warning horn, and the voice message system.

area.title: Probe Heat Switch
area.impl: The switch is operable and the caution light comes on but no tests are performed

ul.li: PROBE HEAT - Energizes the pitot, fuselage air data, AOA, and temperature probe heaters & monitors while on the ground.
OFF - Airborne, these systems are automatically on.
TEST - PROBE HEAT caution light flashes 3-5 times per second.
EPU/GEN - The test switch is spring loaded to the OFF position and provides a means to test the EPU generator and EPU PMG output to Flight Control System (FLCS) on the ground without using hydrazine.
OFF - Normal operation.
Illuminate to indicate proper power output of the Flight Control Computer (FLCC) during FLCS power tests.
TEST - Tests FLCC power output and EPU electrical power output.
NORM - Normal operation.
MAINT - Puts the FLCS in maintenance mode for ground tests (not implemented).
Inflates the G suit and tests the pressure-breathing system.

area.title: Digital Backup Switch
area.impl: The switch is operable and the DBU eyebrow light is illuminated but the backup software is not implemented

ul.li: DIGITAL BACKUP - Selects backup software in the Flight Control Computer (FLCC) in the event of software failures in the primary program.
OFF - Normal operation using primary software.
ALT FLAPS EXTEND - TEFs are extended.
NORM - the trailing edge flaps (TEFs) are controlled by the landing gear status.
Enables the airplane to perform an automatic 'fly-up' when manual terrain following is on and the aircraft gets too close to terrain.
RUN - Indicates a FLCS BIT test is running.
FAIL - Indicates a test failure.
LE FLAPS LOCK - Manually locks the LEFs in position.
AUTO - LEFs are automatically controlled as a function of mach, altitude, and AOA.
FLCS RESET - Performs servo or electronic reset of FLCS and it clears all warning and caution lights if successful.
OFF - Normal operation.
BIT - On the ground, performs FLCS test which takes ~45 seconds to complete.
OFF - Normal operations.
Trims ROLL rate (levels the wings).
Indicates ROLL trim setting.
NORM - Enables the Trim switch on the HOTAS and permits autopilot engagement.
DISC - Disables the Trim switch on the HOTAS and prohibits autopilot engagement.
Trims YAW rate (nose left/right).
Trims PITCH rate (nose up/down).
Indicates PITCH trim setting.
MASTER (guarded) - Opens main fuel shutoff valve.
OFF (unguarded) - Closes main fuel shutoff valve.
Reduces tank pressurization and allows Halon gas flow to F-1, A-1, and internal wing tanks.
OFF - De-energizes all electric fuel pumps.
NORM - Energizes all pumps Center of Gravity (CoG) is maintained automatically.
AFT - Transfers fuel from aft tanks to engine and forward tanks (CoG moves forward).
FWD - Transfers fuel from forward tanks to engine and aft (CoG moves aft).
OPEN - Opens refueling door; places FLCS in reduced gains below 400 kts; and depressurizes external tanks.
CLOSE - Closes refueling door; returns FLCS to normal gains; and pressurizes external tanks.
OFF - Powered down.
STBY - Powered up, but not transmitting.
LOW/NORM - IFF recognition and reply.
EMER - Transmits an emergency-indicating pulse.
ZERO - Transponder code is erased.
A/B - Transponder code slot selection (A or B).
HOLD - Retain transponder code settings after flight.
UFC - Provides for normal control of CNI using the Up Front Controls (UFC).
BACKUP - Provides for alternate operation of UHF, TACAN, and IFF (Mode 4 and EMER functions only) using the backup controls on this panel.
A - Selects Mode 4 Code A.
B - Selects Mode 4 Code B.
OUT - Disables Mode 4 reply.
MONITOR AUDIO - Enables 0.5-second tone when not replying to valid M-4 interrogations.
OUT - Disables M-4 monitor function.
The desired channel and band are set via the small bottom pushbutton levers

area.title: Backup TACAN Function Switch
area.impl: Only T/R and A/A TR modes are implemented

ul.li: T/R - Interrogates and receives signals from TACAN ground stations for DME information.
A/A TR - Interrogates and receives signals from aircraft.
REC - Receive-only mode (bearing only; no distance information).
Turns on the white anti-collision strobe light on top of the vertical tail.
Controls the flash/steady state of the lights controlled by the WING/TAIL & FUSELAGE switches.

area.title: Wing/Tail Switch
area.impl: Turns lights ON or OFF in conjunction with the FUSELAGE lights

ul.li: BRT - Turns on the red and green wingtip and inlet lights, and the white light at trailing edge of the vertical tail.
OFF - Turns off the inlet and vertical tail lights; allows the red and green wingtip lights to be controlled by the FORM knob.
DIM - Turns all lights on dim.

area.title: Fuselage Switch
area.impl: Turns lights ON or OFF in conjunction with the WING/TAIL lights

ul.li: BRT - Turns the white floodlights at the base of the vertical tail on bright.
OFF - Turns off the white floodlights.
DIM - Turns them on dim.
Varies the intensity of the white formation lights on top and bottom of fuselage and, when the WING/TAIL switch is OFF, varies the red and green wing-tip lights.
Enables/disables all external lighting except landing and taxi lights, which have a separate switch on the left aux console.
Varies the intensity of the aerial refueling door lights if the AIR REFUEL switch is open.
